issues.text: Whether on the facts and circumstances of this case ,there is a change in the persons carrying on the business within the meaning of section 8 1 of the Excess Profits Tax Act, 1940, with effect from 14th April, 1943, when the business, which had previously been carried on in partnership between two Dayabhaga Hindu undivided families, was carried on by a partnership between the separated male members of the two families?

anchor.surface_text: Whether on the facts and circumstances of this case ,there is a change in the persons carrying on the business within the meaning of section 8  1  of the Excess Profits Tax Act, 1940, with effect from 14th April, 1943, when the busi-

issues.text: Whether the business prior to 14th April 1943 was carried on by two Hindu undivided families through their kartas or by the eight individual male members as partners?

anchor.surface_text: The two separated brothers, as kartas of their respective families, started a business in partnership under the name and style of Kshetra Mohan Sadhukhan and Sannyasi Charan Sadhukhan, each having an eight-annas share in the profit and loss thereof. Sannyasi charan Sadhukhan died in 1932 and his sons were admitted into the partnership and the business was companytinued by Kshetra Mohan Sadhukhan and the sons of Sannyasi Charan Sadhukhan.

issues.text: Whether a partnership entered into by the kartas of two Hindu undivided families is in law a partnership between the kartas individually or between the families such that other members become partners ipso facto?

anchor.surface_text: When two kartas of two Hindu undivided families enter into a partnership agreement the partnership is popularly described as one between the two Hindu undivided families but in the eye of the law it is a partnership between the two kartas and the other members of the families do lot ipso facto become partners.

issues.text: Whether the assessee is entitled to carry forward deficiencies from periods prior to 14th April 1943 under section 7 of the Excess Profits Tax Act in view of the change in persons carrying on the business?

anchor.surface_text: The assessee claimed that the total deficiencies amounting to over Rs. 84,000 carried forward from previous years up to the chargeable accounting period ending 13th April, 1943, should be added to the sum of Rs. 12,804 and the aggregate amount should be carried forward under section 7 of the Excess Profits Tax Act.

issues.text: Whether the assessee can advance before the Supreme Court a case as to the constitution of the firm that was not made before the Tribunal?
